I guess that "Stand Up Guys" is intended to be Al Pacino and Christopher Walken's version of "The Bucket List," since apparently every aging male movie star is required to have one before wrapping up his career. And true to the body of work of these two seminal actors, this outing takes the form of a crime comedy/drama, in which they portray geriatric gangsters, one (Walken) retired and the other (Pacino) just paroled after 28 years in the slammer (I use the word "slammer" intentionally in an attempt to capture at least some of the anachronistic flavor of this throwback to a bygone era of gangster-movie melodrama). It turns out that Walken has only been allowed to live all these years on the condition that he whack Pacino for killing the only son of an equally decrepit mob boss played by Mark Margolis.

The humor in Noah Haidle's screenplay consists mainly of jokes about the men's various ailments (with a special emphasis on impotence) and medications.  When they're not trying to procure Viagra, they're lamenting the good old days, banging hookers, or going off on little escapades like breaking their buddy (Alan Arkin) out of a retirement home for some just-for-old-times-sake "tough guy" fun-and-games on the road.

Directed by Fisher Stevens, the movie feels as wheezy and creaky as the characters it's depicting. The whole thing is based on the premise that there's nothing quite so amusing or heartwarming as watching an assortment of septuagenarians behaving as if they were still in their 20s. The result is patronizing and condescending to both the actors and the members of the audience regardless of their ages.

There's also a sequence at a cemetery (with a hapless Julianna Margulies bearing witness to it) that's a strong contender for Least Plausible Scene of the Year Award.

As to the performers themselves, Walken's effective underplaying is not sufficient to counteract Pacino's endless scenery-chewing.

And while it's nice to see actors of a certain age getting movie roles these days, does it have to be in a vehicle of roughly the same vintage?
This movie had badass action from legendary actors. I enjoyed every part of this movie. The ending was great. You should definitely watch it.
I thought it was a neat take on the mafia genre but it seemed like it was lost at times and never really built up the characters relationships enough.

You'd figure a movie with these actors would be way most excellent. Not quite the case. It was very slow paced. We continually waited for something to happen. I'd say don't buy it and wait until its free on cable.
Great cast, great movie, some violence, some profanity, and lots and lots of laughs.  Highly recommend if you like these three great actors.
The cast is great and the movie plot is unique. It's a movie I will be able to watch many times.
This is a "once-only" watch movie. It is a bit slow, but i enjoyed the ending... Make sure you either have enough "ammo or chewing gum"

A terrible film with wonderful actors. Time has made this film irrelevant. Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, if they had lived to be 60. Still, I'd rather see an original film fail, than a safe film succeed. Nice try.
-- how could you not enjoy a film with these fine actors!  It was surely not the best these guys have done, but very, very enjoyable!
what a great cast and great movie. superstars are through and through this funny but touching story. i love it
Christopher Walken - need I say more? Listening to him articulate dialog is entertaining enough to find value in the rental fee.
One of the best adult comedy I have ever seen.  They did a fabulous job..laughed a lot. and also cried at times.

The movie was just okay for me. I watched it with my 20 something sons=mistake. A lot of the humor was WAY cheaper than it should have been considering the star power they had here. What could have been a stellar movie was just a non -sparkler.
What kept it from being a "dislike" was the character that C. Walken plays.

This movie proves, as if it needed to be proved, that you can corral the best actors but without a halfway decent script - you have garbage.  They repeat the same brothel scene not once but twice - and believe me, the joke is stale the first time.  There is an absolutely meaningless scene of the stars driving a car - there is no motivation for it other than the three want to see how fast the car can go.  And of course it pads the film out.  The script is witty enough to have been written by a fifteen year old with no imagination and even less intelligence.  No one wants to sit through a film about aging gangsters that could hav ebeen written by one in between hits of Alka-Seltzer and warm milk.  Pacino does his "Scent of a Woman" schtick in a seedy bar dancing with a young woman - again the scene goes nowhere.  Juliette Margolies is wasted here.  I think we are meant to laugh while Walken recites all the medications he is taking.  Too, the entire premise of the film - that Walken must kill Pacino or face death himself is silly.  Is it so difficult to kill Pacino's character?  Anybody could do it while the character sleepwalks through the streets of whatever godforsaken city the film is situated in.  Arkin's sole reason for being in the film is to get a laugh out of being able to satisfy two women sexually and to drive a car very fast.  Both of the lead characters lead lives that are so dead and empty that it is difficult to care much whether they kill themselves or not.  To both, death seems preferable to life - it is certainly preferable than sitting through this film more than once.  Please, save your time and money.  You want a good gangester film about an aging gangster stick with "Donnie Brasco".
Thoroughly enjoyed this film, Al Pacino at his best, great story, wonderful camaraderie, would recommend to all. Please watch it!
Walken and Pacino are great with a good story and plot. You will enjoy to the end I guarantee. Great flick

Every minute of this movie was a pleasure to watch.  I love, love Christopher Walken and he was superb in this roll.  All of the actors did a great job and the movie is certainly worth renting.  If you love these actors, rent the movie, sit back and just enjoy watching them do what they do best...entertaining you.

While I am sure many would downplay the film because they might expect a film full of gunfire, explosions, and so on... You should walk into it with an open mind.  It is not an "action" film, even though one might think that by the cast.

This film is about 3 old boys, going out one last night and doing what they used to do.  One last night on the town, while the old bones can still hold up.  While there is some action, some gun play.  It is more about the relationship between the main characters; the show of respect, subtle emotions, and honor.

I know this short review cannot explain the film properly.  So, I will end it quickly.  But, if you enjoy Walken and Pacino.  Not the characters they play, but the men themselves, and are curious to see how they play off each other.  This is a great film to see.  The way they feed each other's performance, the way their unique styles mesh, it is quite an interesting thing to see.

Rent it, if you are not sure.  Buy it, if you understand what I was trying to say.
My husband was the Prison guard that led Al P. out  of the prison at the very beginning of the movie.  I really liked the concept of the movie.  It had a special ending to it.

The plot is pretty catchy and serves as a backing to a short duration story which thus keeps everything moving quickly. The charachters in this movie all have lines you'd swear they wrote. Walken and Arkin steal the show. I'd watch this again anytime,

The relationship between the three was heart-warming.  I have seen movies of all three actors when they were younger and now I still enjoy them.  Christopher Walken has an acting style that is still evident in him today.
Loved this movie with some of my favorite actors.  Acting was top notch as I expected.  Al Pacino and Christopher Walken still have it.

The script was choppy, despite the experience of the leading actors (Pacino and Walken). And the storyline was boring, predictable, and an affront to all who love watching both of these aging thespians.
I was so disappointed. 45 minutes in and I was still wondering when the action would begin.  Couldn't even finish it.
Not what I expected out of the Stars.  Very slow plot development and dark.  Was hoping for more out of the cast and story line.  I didn't think it was worth what I paid for the movie.

This movie is absolutely remarkable in evey scene.  So, C. Walken meets up with his old buddy who is getting our of prison.  From that point, it's on.  These actors make it so real-urban wise guys that seem to have made it to old age.  It's funny as hell.

this was a terrible movie with great actors. don't waste your time or money on this one
this movie sucks

A guy road trip down memory lane. Had some fun parts and some that were supposed to be funny but, I thought, were not so.
Good movie to pass the time watching really great actors acting past their prime.

So this is not a critical masterpiece or movie that will change your life, but it is Walken and Pacino being Walken and Pacino and that's all you need to know, really.  It's a funny B-movie that's perfect for a night with friends, pizza, and beer.

these guys made a fun flick, possibly made it up as they went along; which for the actors involved,...worked. Not award worthy but a good guy flick; especially us 40+ guys,....ok,...maybe 50+. Kinda like a RED without all the toys or staff. More acting than blowing stuff up but with a twisted fun approach. Worth a watch.
This movie dragged and dragged.  It was "over-starred" and should never have been produced.  I would not recommend this DVD to anyone.
Stand up guys boring waste of money. Goes nowhere great cast can't save horrible screenplay with no plot and amateur dialog
really enjoyed the movie. they don't make em like these guys anymore. i been around that life and the movie was pretty accurate.
Slow moving.  Expected more from these actors.  Times the film just almost stood still.  Luck would have it that I watched on a flight to Japan so I was a very captive audience.

The idea is endearing, but this was just so bad. The dialogue was so horribly cheesy that even the A-list cast couldn't make it work. Wait for it to be free, or better yet just skip it altogether. I wish I did instead of paying 4 bucks to complain the whole time!

The beginning was kind of difficult to follow, almost lost me. It got better then not not too sure what happened.

It's a story about good friends that remain loyal to each other, so it's OK.
eeeeh not a classic by any means. Would have rather not watched this if it is the last movie anyone of these actors ever makes.

Some excellent acting here, the aging actors don't have to work for a laugh, their timing has become who they are. No actor in the group is trying to steal the spotlight; they're just out for a good time as if was the last night of their lives. And yet, the story line kept my wife and I interested until the end. We are memorizing a line from the show and using it for more laughs later. "There's only two options. Kiss ass or chew gum.... I'm all outta gum."
Well told story populated by good actors, well filmed. It seemed this story told a story closer to the truth than many I've seen in the past. I liked it, it was refreshing!
A very straight forward gangster kind of movie. Simple plot with good action sequences. Al Pacino and Christopher Walken are great together.
Great movie with great actors. You think you have it figured out (and the story line is not too mysterious) but it keeps you watching!

This is an old fashion guys movie. Totally believable, if quirky, performances by all the actors.  Best old guys movie in years. Best of all the movie was not based on short attention video game action that constitutes the majority of the screen time in all too many of todays movies.  Yes, there was violence but fortunately, it was not the how many bodies can we pile up, how much FX can we employ, and how can we include a few more explosions movie making that bores to tears after the first 10 minutes.  The violence was believable and the comic touches broad but never degenerating into slapsticks. It's true you don't get to know "what's really in their souls" but the two main characters are not the "let me tell you my innermost secrets" type guys.  That said, you really know the characters as the movie progresses.  Definitely a movie I look forward to seeing again rather than a "forty minutes wasted, I'm out of here" experience.
Good actors doing a good job. My old time favorites that are ending their acting days. A plot that is a little plausible. No surprises.
an o.k film...Al Pacino is great...wish the script were better as all actors are capable of better performances...its the acting that makes the film worth watching....
Cute story line, just a little slow and almost lagging at certain parts. If it were not for the great cast, I probably would not have finished watching it.

The chemistry between Pacino, Walken and Arkin works on a subtle but powerful level. I especially loved the "dance scene" in the where Pacino's character trys to pick up 3 women and is soundly rebuffed with a drink tossed in his face. Also the brotheral scenes are hilarious as are the viagra overdose scenes. This film is a perfect mix of dark humor, action-drama and tragedy, which may be overlooked or not fully appreciated by American film audience due to no large budget over-blown special computer generated effects.

People are completely missing the point of this movie. The point is that amongst the dialogue and the action, there is an undercurrent of melancholy and a great deal of wisdom. There is a certain rhythm to this movie along with a kind of self-effacing sarcasm, if you are not picking up on the rhythm, you aren't going to get it. But if you do you will thoroughly enjoy the witty conversation which is mixed in with some very serious material. You will understand Christopher Walken's inability to smile, you will contrast this with Al Pacino's conscious decision to always joke around in spite of what he knows, it his way of standing up to fate. This isn't just a movie about a few ex gangsters, nor is it a "bucket list" movie, it is clearly a movie about the undercurrents and different sorts of elements in life that affect all people and how different people deal with them in different ways. You will be able to recognize a great deal of philosophy hinted at throughout the film. It's brilliantly written on many levels.
Considering the cast, I expected more. A few laughs, but it could have been so much more. A bit corney for them.  It was just okay.
I love these actors, but it was missing something.  I thought the theme was fine, maybe it was the script/dialogue that needed more.

Being 55 now and growing up on these guys, this is a great way to remember them as gangsters. Buddy flick and bucket-list with an enjoyable storyline and story telling. Fun and fairly well creative.

This review is from a regular guy, not some pseudo critic with an overblown sense of his own importance or relevance to watching movies. If you have accumulated bountiful life experience, you will appreciate this.

I'd like to think I'd carry myself the same.

This movie is just wrong on so many levels.  Pacino is his stereotypical character.  The script is awful, the music is awful, the location shots were awful.  We wondered if these guys were "made an offer they couldn't refuse."  Don't waste your time or your money.  If I ever meet Pacino I will tell him he owes me $3.99!
Great to see these actors working together.  Some funny episodes.  The script wasn't bad, but could have been a lot better.
It's okay, but it doesn't stick to the bones.  No real action till the very end and then it's silly.  Kind of a forgettable film.

Great acting, great story, great script, great directing, great cinematography.  This overlooked gem is a must-see for anyone who's a fan of any of the principals (Pacino, Walken, Arken).  Julianna Margulies has a great turn as Arken's daughter and Addison Timlin perfectly played her part (not going to give that away...).

What really made this movie great for me was that it was all about the movie and the art of movie making.  No special effects, nothing that really made you suspend disbelief enough to question the authenticity of the story.  The characters suck you in and hold you until the bitter end.

And I highly recommend it on DVD because there are so many places I got to laughing that if I couldn't have hit the pause, I would have missed too much.

This movie is for movie fans.  Probably won't do too well with teenagers that aren't into the classics, but if you like the Godfather, Goodfellas, LA Confidential, Secondhand Lions, you'll love this.
I love seeing great actors that you've seen over the years in a movie all together. Had a few funny parts.
With these actors, you would think how could I go wrong??? But WRONG is exactly what my decision was. Evidently these actors needed a paycheck. Save you time and money - steer clear of this one!!!

Ughh. This movie spends the first twenty minutes following Al Pacino on a quest for Viagra. If that's what they mean by "stand up guys," I get it. But the movie is boring. I cannot recommend this film at all. Rent it if you LOVE these three great actors, but if you want an exhilarating or entertaining experience, seek it elsewhere. Probably the best new gangster film out is Gangster Squad (2012).
Good movie Good story line I found this very enjoyable, I would recommend this movie for family viewing. a great present for anyone.

Three long time friends, friends for life, rich and poor, in and out, prison and freedom. Val, played by Al Pacino, is released from prison after 28 long years, after taking one for the boys, so to speak. At the gate to meet him him, is Doc, played by Christopher Walken. They hug and talk and take off in Doc's old car. They have dinner, drink, go to a 'cat house', where Val discovers he can't get it up. Off to a pharmacy where thy steal needed drugs and back to the cat house. A hidden agenda in all of this is that one man has been hired to kill the other. Their other good friend, Hirsch, is in an old folk's home. Off they go, steal him out of bed, away from his oxygen. Several incidents later, including a stolen hot car, police chase, fight with some real toughs, they end up back at one of Doc's favorite restaurants.

These guys have fun. They all understand they have limited time, and use it artfully. I want these guys to be part of my bucket list. Come on, guys, let's go have fun!

We all understand that much of this can only really occur in our fantasy. You can't take a man from his oxygen out for a night and expect him to keep on breathing. We run into several well known actors through out this night, so exciting. Lost daughters, new clothes, more food than you can ever imagine, and, three old guys, life Long friends. What else could you ever want?

Recommended. prisrob 06-28-13
The story is slow and really has no 'bang' to it.  They missed a lot of opportunity for laughs with someone being in jail for so long.  But, still a good buddy-buddy flick.

I suspect Fisher Stevens, not known for his film directing acumen, just lined up the actors, said go and got out of the way.  There's not much of a script or a story here, but it does have a cast of legendary actors doing their thing.  Val (Al Pacino) is getting out of prison for taking the rap during a heist that managed to kill the son of the mob king pin.  Val's ride from prison is an old compatriot known as Doc (Christopher Walken).  Doc is still under the employ of Claphands (Mark Margolis) and his assignment is to kill Val, his friend by the next day.  Claphands blames Val for his son's death.

Val has this figured out and seems OK with it.  He understands but wants to have a little fun first.  Straight laced (by comparison) Doc goes along with it.  They decide to go to the retirement home of their "driver" Hirsch (Alan Arkin).  He unhooks himself from his oxygen and away they go in a newly heisted Dodge Challenger SRT.  These guys are funny as hell, especially when they go to their favorite bordello, now run by the daughter (hilarious Lucy Punch) of their more familiar madam.

Doc is really conflicted as he doesn't want to kill Val.  He can't talk Claphands out of it but when his granddaughter's life is threatened, Doc and Val decide to go with plan B.  "Stand Up Guys" isn't a great film.  It's not well directed and meanders a lot, but come on.  With Pacino in full "chatterbox" mode and Walken providing classic nonverbal reactions and Arkin now so excited to "live" again, this film is just plain fun to watch.

I do not believe that Christopher Walken, Al Pacino or Allan Arkin will win an Oscar for this movie, but for the purpose of entertainment, it was good.  It is a comedy and a drama, for those of us that like to mix things a bit once in a while.  As always, their caliber as actors is excellent.
The ending was very disappointing. Did they run out of money making the ending? I did like Christopher Walken's role, I'd give him 6 stars!
something about the show was ok.  though I like the friends forever theme.  You know go threw the rough and good times together.
This movie will not disappoint you. We really enjoyed watching actors who can act. It is worth the time and you should enjoy it.

With the line-up in this movie I expected greatness, but got goodness instead.  I liked the film and will watch it again, but I though it would be better.  Alan Arkin's role should have been bigger.  It is a very entertaining movie, and I do recommend it.

This movie is more like three and a half stars. The acting of course was great with Pacino and Walken. This movie was about friendship and is a little slow; however a decent movie if you're not expecting more.

Absolutely loved it.  Love these actors, great story premise.  Funny! If you're young, you may not enjoy it as much, but I enjoyed more than anything I've seen in a long time.  My wife enjoyed it very much also

You can almost guess the way this will end, but you have to stick around to see it anyway.
I liked the flick because of the characters in it. I kind of hoped  they would put together a better plan at the end but they  didn't ,so....
Fun flick great actors and some good grace filled relationships. Language and sex can be rough but meaningful movie not one for young children

A predictable melodrama created to provide employment for the aging actors that it showcases. You know at the start how it will end, like most tales of revenge. Tries much too hard to be novel. Inevitable car chase not overdone; surprise.
All I can say was at least I was on a plane so either way 2 hours of my life was wasted.

This is just another old men movie. You would only watch this if, like me, you are an old man, fantasizing that you are still trash talking, still hard drinking, still a hard ass and hard in the shorts (with the help of a fistful of stolen Viagra). It's sad seeing a great actor like Robert De Niro do this kind of cash cow. It's even sadder seeing Alan Arkin play another funny and cool dead guy. He already did that superbly in "Little Miss Sunshine". So, send the old boys a few bucks for making old fools out of themselves.
The casting was excellent, the plot a Thelma and Louise re-run. Still, worth the watch if you appreciate old guys.

This movie is terrible. I really like Pacino, Walken and Arkin and they are really the only thing that keeps this movie from getting 1 star. The basic plot is good but the execution is terrible and the sub plots are atrocious. A couple of items that ask you to suspend all logic and credibility is expected in some films but this movie strings a ton of them together from beginning to end, with one exception, an ending that gives no closure and leaves you to guess what happens. That would have been acceptable in a well done movie but so long as they are going to make the first 98% of the movie an unbelievable string of events then why not at least give you closure at the end. I would bet they would all admit to this being their least favorite movie of their careers.
I guess this is Hollywood's way of trying to make new movies appealing. You can't just take three Academy Award winning actors and put them in crap and call it good. Terrible!

They had a great opportunity to make a great movie but the writing just didn't make it. I like to say that good writing can make a mediocre actor look great but even a great actor can't help poor writing. It's too bad considering what they could have done with these 3 great actors.

2 old guys who have been violent, and self-absorbed their whole lives, find a few redeeming days at the end of their lives where they fondly remember the good old days and do a few things for the first time NOT based on violent exploitation, and we are to be charmed.  Vomit.
As always these actors have entertained us with style and humor.  I'm glad we've purchased this one so that we can watch it again and still enjoy it.
It was a little strange seeing Al looking so old, but the movie had its very funny moments. Would only be appreciated by a over 35 audience I think.

That was the worst movie I have even seen in my life. Usually I rent movies via Amazon Instant and watch them a minimum of three times each on average. However, THIS MOVIE is one I cant believe i've seen once. The movie progresses very slow and the ending of the movie felt like it just started. If I could turn back the hands of time and do one thing over in my life, it would be renting this movie.

Save your money - this movie is not worth watching. There's no plot and it even seems like the actors don't care at all. It's not funny, it's not interesting, it's not engaging. It's just 2 classic actors saying and doing stupid random things that have no reason or continuity. What a huge disappointment. Time I'll never get back, but I believe Amazon now owes me $4.99.

I really like the actors. But they don't seem to be directed very well. Parts of the dialogue could have been delivered better. The story lacks excitement. During the first 10 minutes, you know what to expect for the rest of the movie. The trailer gives away too much too.

It was obvious from the get-go Christopher Walken was supposed to kill Al Pacino.  It didn't take long before we were begging him to do it now to end our misery of watching the movie.  We  hate to start something and not finish  it.  This was an exception.  I honestly couldn't tell you how much of the movie we watched, though it was probably half.  The acting was not enough to make up for the plodding plot.

Well written and directed and obviously the actors are amazing... but the ending to this movie was enough to make you forget all of that and hate it.  It's as if the writers couldn't decide how it should have ended, so they went with "no ending" instead.  Totally killed what was otherwise a fun movie.

I really had no interest in this film . I love these guys but i had convinced myself their best days and projects were past them . Even as i watched (recently) Mr. Pacino portray Phil Spector (very good project as well) . The aged gangster images on the poster art held no appeal for me . I'm glad my wife turned me onto this film . If you're of a certain age , perhaps it will resonate with you as well . Much more satisfying than you may initially think . Have a look see .

I really liked this film.  Unusual to find Al Pacino in this kind of lighthearted fare, but he pulls it off without a hitch.  The combination of Pacino and Christopher Walken works surprisingly well - and Alan Arkin adds character to any film in which he appears.  The plot is a little off beat and more than a stretch of the imagination, but that's what makes it so interesting.  Great for an easy going Saturday night in front of the wide screen TV with a glass of wine.

how can you go wrong with pacino and walken in a comedy? somehow, this film figured out how to do just that. the film lacked energy. it felt like an inexperienced director and/or editor mailed in a mediocre job. the acting was ok but it wasn't making me or my wife laugh very much. just generally felt the film was not entertaining enough from beginning to end to warrant a recommended viewing. if you want great comedy, rent HORRIBLE BOSSES instead.
Read some good reviews on this so decided to watch on my Kindle Fire while I was on vacation. Good to watch Al Pacino and Christopher Walken play these old friends in this way.  Great ending.

In my opinion Walken's "tortured quite character" performance was stronger than Pacino's " crusty, just got released antics"... That said, the chemistry between these two characters seemed to work. The powerful bond of a lifetime friendship is what I remember most of this film, and I suppose that is what makes it worth the 3 stars (at least for me).

This movie has "fading star vehicle" written all over it. The storyline is weak at best. Trying to survive on the strength of established actors. The one shining spot is Alan Arkin, who seems to make, in very limited roles, a huge impact. In fact, if not for his presence in this movie I would not have watched it to the end. If you are a fan of Pacino and/or Walken, this is NOT the movie you want to remember them by. In spite of Arkin's moments, I cannot recommend this movie in good conscience unless you are a fan that has to see everything done by any of these actors.

This is an interesting movie. It was a bit disconcerting to see just how much both actors have aged; however, this storyline thlped to showcase the actors as the elder people they are. This was not a movie comparable to what these actors have done in the past, but I liked it.

What can I say you pit Alpacino and Christopher
Walken together you know it's going to be a good movie. I give it 4 stars

Stand Up Guys was an OK movie.  The three main actors were worth watching as they played off each other.  But, it dragged at the beginning and didn't really get fun until the last scene.  That was worth the whole movie!

Huge Pacino fan and he never disappoints.  However, he did not wow me in this one.  He was alright as was the rest of the film.  If you are a Pacino fan it is worth seeing for sure just don't expect a blockbuster.

Slow moving.  Plot is predictable and a little to long.
If you need a movie for the plane ride and like Al Pacino go for it.
Plot was not coherent (not a matter of suspense) so it was hard to see their purpose; where they were heading.  Great actors but boy were they showing their age!

Nothing much worth saying about this movie so I won't waste your time with much detail or any major detail concerning what the movie is about. Stand Up Guys suffers from something pretty common, that being it's a typical run-of-the-mill slightly better than forgettable story. Aging gangster get's out of prison, get's picked up by his best friend at the gates, who he doesn't know is also hired to kill him. The story is simple. They ride along together, have some fun, meet up with another old gangster pal and go to a cat house, eat a diners, and drive around while one guy decides if he can kill his friend or not. Not much else else to be said about this movie. Walken, Pacino and Arkin are all fine, but their acting is spot-on average for their abilities, the script is somewhat basic and dull, there's really no action, mediocre comic moments, and not much drama. It's pretty much a rather forgettable movie
Keeping it short and sweet: The movie was great, the actors were great. Always liked Al Pacino. A must see movie.
Good action, good humor.  Not necessarily a chick-flick but might be suitable for date night when you're staying in.  Al Pacino and Christopher Walken match up well.
Interesting story line, if unlikely to happen. Kind of dark comedy and at the same time warm feeling at times. It's worth watching to see a different perspective on how hoodlums deal with aging.
Pacino and Walkin were both 5 stars. This was the kind of movie you wouldn't  mind watching a 2nd time.
great movie funny and sad great cast look great in hd very please with amazon prime insant watch good story line cool ending tho
Kinda funny, kinda sad, as seen from the eyes from a few guys after their life of crime.  Pacino, and Walkin definitely make the movie worth a watch.  Definitely not a Die Hard type flick.
This film was a bit slow moving but contained a decent storyline. There were several funny moments and overall good time watching excellent actors work their craft.

we just watched this and were surprised- first at the unusual roles and then slower pace. It actually was a terrific movie.
Highly recommend for those that enjoy thinking and relationship with a twist.
terrible, terrible movie.  We kept watching it thinking that at some point a story line would develop.  What a waste of time!!
These fine actors took bland lines and gave the bland dialogue some life.  The best thing about this movie was watching Pacino and Walken working together.
I am normally a fan of both Al Pacino and Christopher Walken, but their performances in this movie were brutal.  I had to shut it off after the first 30 minutes.

I was super excited with the cast of this movie.  It got off to a very, very slow start.  And then it didn't really pick up any speed.  Finally it started coming thru and ended ok.  I was slightly unhappy that I chose to buy instead of rent.  I'd recommend it as a rental.
The cast is unbeatable, when has Christopher Walken done a bad movie? (More Cowbell),..Al is just great and Alan Arkin is great! Rent it, perfect for a Sunday afternoon with rain and no football.
It was like the bucket list for the old timers.  The did the damage there way.  The bad guys got their pay back.
This is a retired "gangster" movie.  All the old guys were very cute, good plot, fabulous end.  There should be a sequel!
I am a huge Al Pacino fan......I was a bit disappointed with this movie.  I enjoyed the friendship between the men, I just thought some of it was a bit stupid.

this movie was better than I expected. It was a little predictable but who cares. It was kind of like mobster guys doing their bucket list. Great performances all around, you can tell these guys like each other. It won't disappoint !
It was just as good as I hoped it would be.  I liked the characters and the story.  It had a bunch of great lines and scenes.  They were just great guys!  Sure it was a little cheesy but fun.
This movie was so-so.  Three great actors in a contived movie which seems to be written just as a vehicle for them.  A VERY SLOW plot.

I grew up watching these guys in some of my favorite movies. All great actors in their own right. Wacthing this movie and seeing how they have aged made me feel old. It is entertaining, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kidd type ending. OOPS

I liked it until it stopped 34 minutes into the movie and I was unable to watch anymore.  I wasted my money.  Is there any way I can finish the movie?  Please help.  Tape was broken and would not move past the 34 minute mark.

I want my time and money back!!!Straight to the garbage with this one. I don't even want to give them one star but I guess I have to.
I enjoyed it more because of Al Pacino & Christopher Walken were in it. The story was alright which why this is good for ideo.
Love the actors but the movie is a little slow. I think they just could have done more with the Talenf they had available.
I had high hopes for this movie.  Even with the aged cast, these guys can still get the job done.  Unfortunately the story sucked and the actors couldn't make the movie what i thought it should be.

Watching great actors playing age appropriate roles is special.  Two old guys get their buddy out of a rest home and have a night to celebrate their time in youth.

The lines are very subtle.  Pacino, when asked what he would like to achieve or what he had wished he had done, says, "Finish high school."

This is a blast.  Forget the popcorn, go to chips and beer.
At first I didn't give it a chance  but turned it in a second time and it really was a great story with two great actors
I liked the movie but I was expecting something a little more comedic. It is more of a drama then comedy just so other know.
Movie started out kind of slow. But picked up a little towards the end. I would recommend to wait until you see this on one of the pay channels
Fun movie with a few twists you don't see coming. Great actors having a great time. Definitely worth watching for the "legends" alone.

I was a little upset with the overall story line. There was a lot more of  talking amongst the actors than I expected. I was hoping for more action scenes. The actors fit the role but it just seem to lack the punch I had seen in their previous endeavors.

Pacino plays a mob associate who took the rap for the whole gang and spent 25 years in prison.  The problem is that his stray bullet accidently killed the boss's son in the big shootout that led to his arrest.  Now the sadistic boss is forcing his best friend to kill him.  Naturally, they must steal pills, a car, get a 3rd partner out of a nursing home, solicit prostitutes, and get involved in a random brutal vigilante mission for a stranger before going after the big boss...no surprises here.
I was very disappointed with the directing and writing in this movie.  It had no point, and never got off the ground
Sucked, turned it off before midway.  Don't waste u'r money. (or time for that matter)  Life is to short, I lost :30 to this movie. I was robbed!!!
Its OK.  With the cast that it has, it's pretty hard to go wrong.  It is a good way to spend some extra time.

I, too, was mislead by the actors credentials and the trailer. 35 minutes into the movie - and NOTHING but bad language, old and overly used "jokes(?)"-(NOT funny) relating to an overdose of viagra and other prescription drugs - snorted like cocain, visits to a whorehouse and endless bla, bla, bla totally without any relation to the actual story. Yes, you know that Walken has a contract to eliminate Pacino (if you are not asleep by then), that's about it that relates to the plot - assuming there is actually a plot! Pacino's character is a cookie cutter image of an old criminal,
pitiful and insane and an insult to the older population - criminal or not.
After watching 40 minutes hoping the plot would move on (it didn't), I gave up. No clue how this mess ended, probably by Walken, Pacino and Arkin blowing the bad guy away, Hurrah!! Please no nasty comments, I may be dead wrong. Actually I don't care.
I only want my 40 minutes back - I'm glad it was not 2 hours!
Stay away from this horrible trash - FAR AWAY!
I wish that  I would've read the one stars before renting this movie.  I'm in the middle of it and can't go on any longer!!!

Enjoyed this movie.  The plot, at times, got a little slow but the acting was superb, as you would expect it to be with these three stars.  In today's action, shoot em up flicks the younger generation seems to like, it was cool to see how they incorporated actual acting ability into those types of scenes.  The car chases were superb, especially with the banter back and forth.

I expected better writing with a cast like this.
while I did enjoy the film, and sometimes quite a lot, I think
Seven Psychopaths
is the film you want to see.

I rented this through Redbox so I didn't buy the movie. I was hoping with all of the stars in this movie that it would have been good, but came away very disappointed. The acting was good, but the writing was very subpar.

The entire of movie was based on a guy spending his day out of prison and the other character was supposed to whack him at the end of the day. A third "old" friend is thrown into the mix and magically has all his medical problems live him to drive a chase scene, wear out a hooker, and then die behind the wheel of a stolen car while waiting for his other old friends.

Overall the acting was good, but the story was very weak. You would think with an actor like Pacino, whose voice is so commanding that it makes you want to buy a Jeep even though they are junk cars, the movie could have been built behind the power of his voice. But it wasn't.

As a rental, it was OK. I am glad I didn't spend $40 to go to the theater to see this and somewhat happy I didn't fork over $20 to buy the DVD.

The ending was so Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid, absent the leap, that it left you wondering if they had any real good writers typing out the script.

This just reinforces that actors are trained parrots. You put a good script in front of them and get a good director and they sound like people you would follow into battle. But just the opposite makes you wonder if they have the intelligence to brush their own teeth..

Three legends at their best, the chemistry and camaraderie between them is palpable throughout.  Played by all with equal doses of self deprecating humor and steely ego born of years honing their skills.  It is nearly impossible to separate who they are from the 'characters' they are depicting.  The plot is just garnish here.  Forming the elegant backbone of the film are three simple stand up guys doing what they do best, the thread of immortality at their core sluffing off any pesky aspects of old age.
Sad to see so much talent go to waste, lame plot with no real good storyline just bland. It just seemed like a bunch of old actors who decided to throw a movie together.

I grew up watching Al Pacino and Christopher Walken from their early starts to their current films. I've loved almost every character they've played and every movie they've been in. So when I heard that they were going to be in a movie together playing old time mobsters I was delighted. I'm pleased to say that while this movie doesn't offer them at their extreme best, it is a wonderful film that I might find myself tempted to watch again in the future.

Pacino plays Val, a low level criminal who is just getting out of prison having served a 28 year sentence for an armed robbery where someone was killed. Walken plays Doc, his best friend, who shows to pick him up and take him back home. But things have changed in the old neighborhood not to mention with the two old cons that have aged over the years.

Enjoying his time outside Val doesn't want to go back to Doc's place, he wants to go out on the town and enjoy the life he once knew. He doesn't realize until things happen that he's not who he once was. A visit to the old whorehouse they used to go to finds the new Madame is the old one's grand daughter. An unsuccessful go round for Val leads the duo to break into a pharmacy to steal some Viagra. While there, Doc begins to lift a few other drugs that he now takes on a regular basis. The result of the Viagra lends itself to one of the funniest moments in the film.

Val later attempts to hit on a couple young girls at a club thinking he's still the young buck he once was only to get turned down. He's now an old man. As reality sits in he finds new ways to deal with it.

Unknown to Val is the fact that Doc, while his friend, has been given the unenviable task of killing him. It seems that the big boss, Claphands, wants Val dead. During the robbery that landed Val in jail, Claphands son was shot by Val in the crossfire. Even though Val took the fall for the whole group, even though he was a stand up guy, Claphands wants him dead.

Eventually Val realizes what is going to go down. Rather than fight it, he and Doc set off on a series of adventures in an attempt to live life to the fullest until the fateful hour that Doc has to sign off that he's been killed. Included in those adventures is the rescue from a nursing home of their old wheel man Hirsch (Alan Arkin) who has one of the funniest moments in the film when they return to the whorehouse.

What makes this movie so good is the interplay between Pacino and Walken as two friends who have grown old, one who realizes it and has learned to deal with it living on the outside and the other who doesn't at first having been in prison for 28 years. Living those years in a cell Val hasn't seen the world around him change but Doc has. The prescription scene is one that verifies that. But the camaraderie between these two friends and later Hirsch makes up for their differences and unites them as friends, as stand up guys, until the final moments of the film.

It's rare that either of the lead actors in this film offer a bad performance and here they once again show why they've always been at the top of the list in their profession. Both bring subtle nuances to their roles that many might not see at first but that bring their characters to life. It might be that the roles they play don't lend themselves to being larger than life parts that will become memorable but what they do with these parts makes them realistic and touching in so many ways.

The movie offers many laughs, a heartfelt look at growing old and performances by some of the best actors in the business. It entertains from start to finish and you couldn't ask much more of a movie these days. It may not be a slap in the face effects filled blockbuster of a film but it is one that can be enjoyed more than once.
Quirky lovable performances,  the women chosen were wonderful.  Would see it again. My only gripe is with a choice made by the protagonists that was less than pragmatic.

Entertaining, loved it. Liked the old guys getting even and setting the record straight.
Older folks would like this one.

Loads of fun. From one who usually doesn't like "action" films, I must say that this one has plenty of action without gratuitous noise or violence. There was just enough to tell the story. No lengthy (ergo boring) chase scenes and "hostile interactions". A cast to die for. It was fun to see Christopher Walken in the role of a regular guy and not a creepy character. I would watch this film a second time, just for the fun of it.

In Stand Up Guys - Al Pacino and Christopher Walken get together and nail it.  Unlike another legendary pair-up which fell flat (Pacino with Deniro in Heat & Righteous Kill), Pacino and Walken are really effortless in this.

Some critics bemoaned the lack of this or that - Pacino and Walken not dark enough; not enough depth; weak plot and such, but give the guys a break!  This is a minor classic that rises above what could have been just another typical gangster outing.  Most criminal / wiseguy films try too hard and take themselves way too seriously, which this film never does.

Stand up Guys endears itself by simply letting the two actors take centerstage with strong scenes and great dialogue.  (I remember when DeNiro and Pacino just didn't have enough screen time together in Heat - one scene and that was it.  It was like Michael Mann feared overkill or competition between the two men.)

The chemistry evokes Samuel Jackson and John Travolta in Pulp Fiction - there's an ease and swagger with Pacino wearing the ex-con mantle like his second skin, and Walken playing his faithful, troubled best friend.  Throw in some Alan Arkin (always playing a loony in the movies nowadays) for good measure, and this is about as good as it gets for our all-star 70s team.

Yeah, I thought about Pacino in Godfather 2 and how far he's evolved.  He still talks loud like he has for years, but at least it feels like an old comfortable shoe.  I've also never been much of a Walken fan myself but it's one of his best roles.  What more could you ask for?  Kinda like Ali and Frasier fighting for the 3rd time and giving it their best shot. I didn't expect too much from these guys but they surprised me and exceeded expectations.

Good direction from Fisher Stevens.  The film is more intelligent than it gets credit for and I loved the look and cinematography.  This film definitely deserves a bigger audience.

This film covers a familiar genre of retired criminals reuniting for one final mission.  Of the three co-stars, one is portrayed as a soulful artist while the other two are rambunctious wise-guys. To their credit, the cast is quite talented and they do a very nice job of conveying a mixed mood of tension, humor and sentimentality.  Expect to see some explicit gun violence.
Good movie with great actors aimed at the over 60 crowd.  Most movies today are made for teenagers with the humor, dialog , music , etc. this an exception
Too gritty and pervasive bad language.  Dark and not at all as the trailer portrayed it.  Certainly not up to the Pacino standards.
The movie was great. Far better than I anticipated. The characters were funny and charming. The plot was predictable, but most anything is these days. A great way to pass some time and relax.

This movie could have been way better had Tony Scott been alive to direct it, may he rest in peace.
Fischer Stevens' direction falls short of delivering a gritty action-drama-comedy essence, reminiscent of what many late-80's and early-90's movies were founded on (think True Romance, Reservoir Dogs, Die Hard, Raw Deal, etc). He was certainly near the ballpark, but was still parking his car and didn't quite make it in.
Alan Arkin completely livens up the movie with his short lived role; Walken and Pacino have recited better scripts, and certainly emoted better roles, but all in all, it wasn't a complete train wreck... it was mildly entertaining, and somewhat funny during some scenes.
However, with the running time coming in around one hour and a half, the monkeys helming the script certainly could have come up with a way BETTER way to end the movie.

Do not let any of the negative reviews put you off. This is a great movie.

Due to commercial considerations, I'm not entirely surprised to see that some people could be swayed by inference and perhaps believe (or hope) this to be some kind of full-on gangster dialed-to-the-max action film; gunfights galore, blood, gore, explosions, etc. etc.  It is NOT that sort of film.

It's a slow character piece about three old friends. If you like Walken, Pacino and Arkin, then this is a treat.
Now is the time for all good men to come to the aid of their country.  The brown fox jumped over the fence.
Too bad I saw the ending coming. Great acting by Pachino, Walden and Arkin. Fun story if you don't need a more meaty ending

The trailer looked funny, the movie was painful. Slow, slow, slow and I know they can talk and walk faster - it was horrible. Watched 20 minutes and that was only because we were trying to give it a chance. Can I get my money back?
three superior actors working together and as always acting great but movie is a B and worth seeing on a rainy day
Stand Up Guys is a stand up movie. This movie is very well done Would like to see many more like this movie.

Must love Pacino and Walken to appreciate this movie. Funny with a sprinkle of gangster! If you love these guys you'll love this movie straight to the point Gangster's who just happen to be Granddads .

Wasn't sure what to expect.  Not saying I haven't been disappointed by films with some of these cast members, but on this one they really told a great story.  It was sort of like Good Fellows meet The Last Detail, with a twist (won't spoil the ending).

How can you not like a movie with Al Pacino and Christopher Walken both of them have a dry sense of humor and style that is just hilarious at times. Movie definately could of used a few more quick witted punch lines from this line up but all in all was a very good movie , definately enjoyed the ending

Walken, Arkin, and Pacino do their usual fine work as three criminal friends, one of whom has gotten out of jail after 28 years. His friend has been ordered to kill him by a certain deadline, though, so there is plenty of conflict during the hours until that time.  There is nothing much new to see here, however.

A mobster gone away to prison for a long time gets out with his friend and former accomplice in crime having to perform a secret contract hit on him by the next morning. Sounds pretty good doesn't it? Unfortunately an idea and the execution of that idea are two very different things. The first part of movie starts off pretty good but fairly quickly I found myself thinking ... uh oh. It started giving me the same feeling as if I went to Benihanas Japanese Steakhouse only to learn my favorite secret sauce was watered down that night. It's that type of disappointment.

Direction was ok, photography was ok, production values good but the storyline itself was somewhat corny and ridiculous. When you see older actors beating up on young mobsters ... it reminds me of watching Roger Moore as he aged and was paired up with very young and incredibly sexy leading ladies. I'm sorry, it just doesn't happen in real life and that's what you think watching this movie. So rather than capture perhaps the trials and tribulations aged of mobsters ... you get a "candy version".

This movie grossed only $3 million domestically at the box office which is to say it was a magnificent bomb. With better writing, me thinks it could have been much more. An idea popped into my head that the producers of this movie might owe Pacino and Walken an apology. Did they ever get one? Your guess is as good as mine. Oh yes, I almost forgot Alan Arkin was in the movie too.

Al Pacino, Christopher Waken, and Alan Arkin are like a sublime musical trio the way they riff off each other here.  I'd pay to see these guys read the phone book and I'm sure they would make it funny.  You can just throw away the script here at let these guys go at it.  Truth be told a lot of the dialogue feels improvised.  Pacino gets most of the laughs because he is in his "Scent of a Woman" mode.  Walken plays straight man by default.  Arkin mines the laughs in the spare screen time that he is allotted.  Lucy Punch leaves an impression as the most unlikely madam.  There is a plot.  Who cares.  It's just a vehicle to get these guys together.

This movie was a waste of $5 and a waste of time. The only enjoyable scene is when a stunt driver is driving a car and we're lead to believe that it's Alan Arkin. Furthermore, the writer of this movie has the imagination of a 12 year old. It's normal for movies to have a recurring set, I get that. However, in this one, it's supposed to be Al Pacino's last day alive and he and Walken end up at the same whore house 3 different times and some crappy diner another 3-4 times. I know we all love these actors, but this one is incredibly stale.
A most disappointing movie, considering the cast.  The acting is less than stellar an  the plot is entirely predictable. Don't waste your time.
I loved the acting in this move - especially Christopher Walken; however, the story line was pathetic: over-the-hill criminals trying to be young. UGH!

The cast was comprised of serious classic A-listers all using their stuff. So what happened?  Too much talking, but not enough depth that we cared. The movie wasn't trying to be an action film, but 30 minutes in, there was no progression, a vague plot at best. It just ended as blah as it started.
Loved the second half of the movie.  It was entertaining.  Would I pay money for it?  Probly not but I would watch it if it were a Prime movie.

Well, it's a bit slow overall, but so are the stars. Arkin is 80, Pacino is 73 and Walken is 70, so even with stuntmen and doubles, what do expect? Even old Arnold Schwarzenegger in "The Last Stand" looked older and slower than Walken, and Arnold is just 65.

But if you are a fan of these actors, watch it just to see them. It's just about PG in content, so let your the teens watch your old screen heroes before they are gone.
Al Pacino was great a usual. Very entertaning movie. I enjoyed the premise "Honor among thieves" very well indeed. A

Very funny! Done.
Now an intermission tune sing along if you know the words. Ode D' Joy from B's 9th Symphony
Bad script, stereotypes, couldn't get thru 30 minutes.  Walken, arkin, Pacino wasted in this mess.  Don't wastes your dough today.

This is not a review of the movie.
The quality of the blu ray is excellent.  The picture was sharp and the colors were vibrant.  The audio was very good.  It was worth the price I paid for it.
This is a very bad movie on so many levels.  It is like playing a joke on people in a nursing home, not funny.  You can predict every joke and outcome. Save your money.

I was really anticipating a great character movie here, the first time Pacino and Walken together in a movie. Unfortunately their styles just don't fit together or possibly overlap in some ways. I think Pacino's quick and rapid fire style dialogue in this movie just don't mesh well with Walken's more measured surprising style of dialogue. Walken capitalizes in most movies on moments of silence, storytelling and startled comments. Unfortunately Pacino's more frantic speed walking style of dialogue just don't seem to allow Walken to shine. Walken seems to get lost in a thinker role who doesn't say much of importance throughout the whole movie, almost passing as a kind of chauffeur. Arkin seems to bring much added spiciness later in the movie but even then there's not enough dialogue scenes to really allow them to shine as a group, I was really hoping Arkin would have more of a  'dwellings on his life' speech in this movie which would have added a necessary dynamic. I think this movie tried to rely too much on driving all over the place, visiting a kind of brothel on and on amongst other places which might have made sense but I just don't think it allowed for enough momentous dialogue opportunities, again with Walken hardly ever seeming in his element throughout this movie. This movie did put forth the idea of what it would be like if they were both opposing bosses or something in a movie, that would seem to be a better fit for these actors.

They had a chance to make a great drama. SPOILER ALERT: They could have built more intelligent dialogue regarding the quandry both Pacino's and Walken's characters are in, instead of mixing sensitive, intelligent dialogue with silly situations which press the viewer's "suspension of disbelief:" Old men reducing hookers to quivering groupies, ridiculous car-chase scenes (where the police cars just kind of give-up and go away), old-men beating-up-bad guys, walking mindlessly into a shootout at the end all had the effect of leaving one wondering what movie they're making.

I thought the chemistry and dialogue between Walken and Pacino - especially at the beginning, was EXCELLENT. There is a great dramatic moment as the characters and the viewers realize this is not a warm "homecoming" for recently released from prison Pacino. AND then something else takes over: it's every older man's dream: fast cars, faster women, saving imprisoned females and meting out justice for same and endearing oneself to one's grand-daughter before the credits role. Is there a store these "cutouts" are purchased from?  It was also somewhat awkward to watch the intelligent dialogue mix with one of the silliest car-chase scenes ever. It's almost like two directors. One picks up on the nuance involved in older tough-guys embracing after 28 years, and the other picks up ideas from "Hangover" and "Frat-House" movies, except in this case the vicarious thrills are all slanted for the geriatric audience.

I love Pacino and Walken, and together they have great chemistry. This is a funny story about old friends having their last hurrah. It's a little saccharine sometimes, but these old guys still rock. It's well worth watching.

O.k. Here I go again. This is the type of movie based on character development, you can't beat the cast.
Pacino/Walken/Arkin C'MON!!!! Too cool right!  As I 've said in other reviews, times have changed so have people.
Alot of people (NOT ALL) In my opinion do not have patience, they want the quick fix Movies to just take them to the point.  Think What Tarantino did with R.Dog's and P.Fiction, both I loved..!! Then he threw everyone for a loop with the INCREDIBLE-Jackie Brown!!
My personal Tarantio favorite. Stand Up Guys is not an action film, It's a Great coming of age story of elderly gangsters. It's for people who know Great film making. I give the directer praise. he quotes in the behind the scenes bonus features, It's an "Old School Character Driven piece" he wanted to do right!!  HATS OFF ****

I have never reviewed a movie on Amazon, but this movie was such a disappointment that I felt compelled to review it.

I should have listened to the other negative reviews, but I just thought to myself that there was no way a movie with Christopher Walken and Pacino could be that bad.  I was wrong.  Its not that the acting was bad, its just the characters were not at all cool.  They were trying to sell this old and still hip Pacino, but it just came off as cheesy and somewhat creepy.

Aside from the terrible characters, you would think it would have an entertaining plot.  You would be wrong.  The plot is so basic and really nothing happens.

Do yourself a favor and rent something else.

A stand up guy is defined as someone who refuses to rat out the Family no matter what the pressure, offer, or threat. It is an apt title for this little film that decides at the onset to remain small. It does offer some of our favorite aging actors the opportunity to redefine friendship in a very tender and warm manner. Is it s a great movie? No, not really, but is it worth watching for the joy of seeing Al Pacino, Christopher Walken and Alan Arkin join talents - most definitely `yes.'

Valentino/'Val' (Al Pacino) is an old school, small time, two-bit crook who took the fall for a botched robbery 28 years prior. Being a "Stand up guy", Val did his time and kept his mouth shut, and never revealed any information with regards to the crime; he didn't cop a plea, rat out his friends, and he was tried and sentenced to the full extent of the law. Val's best friend and cohort in crime is Doc (Christopher Walken). While in prison and even now as Val prepares to be reintegrated back into society, Doc has always been there for Val. However, Doc has a heavy burden weighing on his conscious. It seems that during all the gunfire shot amid the botched robbery, Val inadvertently shot and killed the only son of the crime syndicates Boss, Claphands (Mark Margolis). Claphands has waited 28 long years for retribution; and Doc has been ordered to execute the hit on Val, and he only has 24 hours to complete the task or suffer repercussions himself for noncompliance.

In the interim 24 hours we meet the lovely waitress Alex (Addison Timlin) who happens to be Doc's granddaughter, the third member of the old gang Hirsch (Alan Arkin) whom Val and Doc rescue from a rest home to spend the night at a brothel run by Wendy (Lucy Punch), Val's experience with impotence at the brothel that leads him to overdose on Viagra he and Doc steal from a pharmacy and that leads to Val's priapism that requires aspiration in a hospital attended by Nina Hirsch (Julianna Margulies) who is Hirsh's daughter, and a final encounter with the thugs of Claphands and Claphands himself as the 24 hour deadline approaches.

It is all great fun and even more important is the expression of the bond of friendship between Val and Doc, and with Hirsch. Yes the script gets off key at times but this is not meant to be a major gangster film. This is a tale about friendship and loyalty in a crime setting that has just happened to age - not unlike the actors.  Grady Harp, May 13

If you want lots of action, then this is probably not what your looking for. You want a comedy this isn't it either. Nor is it a drama. It is a mixture of them all in doses. I'm not going to gush about the actors ( main characters) because obviously Al Pacino and Christopher Walken are the absolute best at what they do, especially when they are working together. This movie will give you some laughs and give you that "hell yeah!" feeling, but it's also about a friendship and how strong and difficult it can be. Like I said its not Die Hard kind of action or hard comedy it's just a really good movie that leaves you hoping you get the chance to go back to your glory days again. Will definitely be buying this movie.
I have seen all three of these actors in better material. It was slow and kinda meandered all over the place.

There are some moments where one might chuckle but for the most part you will have heard every joke and will have seen some reincarnation of the "comedic" situations in this movie many times before.  This movie is technically a comedy, it's listed as one, but it plays out like a drama, and if you read the description and looked at the cover you probably would think it was a crime drama. It's niether.
This movie was entertaining, I enjoyed it, the acting was good, story was funny,  Walkin and Pacino are great together, Arkin is always good!

Being a fan of all three male leads in Stand Up Guys, I found this hard to resist when offered via instant video. I was not disappointed. It wasn't brilliant or exciting or innovative; it was comfortable. Watching Pacino, Walken and Arkin play off each other was like watching three old buddies get together for a reunion. It's wonderful to see three old pros doing what they do best - light up the screen.
It was a great length - long enough to hold a complete story, short enough to not scream for editors to come finish the job to get on with the story...
Synopses of the plot are everywhere so explaining it isn't necessary here. Let's just say this was so entertaining that I'd pay another time to see it on the big screen. The next day I was still thinking back on it and smiling.
Just a note: This is not a lighthearted comedy. There are some very dark elements. But the viewer who looks at this collaboration and doesn't expect violence and some rough scenes must have come from another planet..
I'm sure some will criticize this for predictability or similarity to other films' endings but, for me, it made for an enjoyable evening. I may just buy the DVD.

It usually takes a lot for me to rate a movie a 1 star.  Most movies I watch have at least something that I find interesting but this one was a straight up DOG!!  When I saw the previews a while back I thought that this was going to be good and that we would get to see Pacino and Walken being back roles they had in the past and incorporate that into this story.  Walken in "King of New York" and Pacino in any number of mob movies was on my mind and that its going to be cool to see these guys in similar roles as old timers.  What we got was a complete mess.  No chemistry between Walken and Al, almost to a point where it felt uncomfortable just watching them.  Everything seemed rehearsed and forced.  So i'm warning anyone that thinks they are going to see two stars of the past relive thier great mob roles....youre not.  I believe this may be the worst movie in Pacino's bag.
I already wasted a lot of time watching this thing, so I'll keep it short.  I'd feel cheated if it were free, just for the loss of time.

I was tempted to rent this film because of the actors and it had a 4 star rating at the time. The only reason I liked this movie (a little) is because I enjoyed seeing Christopher Walken and Al Pacino together.  They were cute, although Al's character was kinda gross.  The robbery scene at the pharmacy was hilarious & original (the only scene that made me laugh out loud).  But overall, I found this movie boring and slow and predictable.  Certainly not a 4 star.  Maybe it's more of a "guy movie"?
awful movie,don't know how they roped Pacino into this one! Self indulgent and adolescent,even my 14 year old disliked it.
I was really looking forward to this movie. Two of my favorite actors, together. What a disappointment. Just a bad movie all around.

A very thin plot, no real action, and an ending that makes you realize you just wasted two hours of your life.  Good acting can not make up for bad writing.  My advice, go watch any of these actors previous films, even if you have seen them multiple times before.  Your two hours would be better spent.

I knew going in that this might not be too original as old actors (Kirk D and Burt L and others) have done this type of story before.  One last fling of bad guys etc.  The script could have been much better and snappier.  There were some good moments but not many.  I expected a lot more humor from these guys.  I enjoyed Arkin in Argo much more than this. And Walken can be so funny too.  His potential for humor was sadly wasted here.  The ending was no big surprise either. Great cast (including the actress who played Wendy - very cute) largely wasted.

This movie is terrible. Great actors and some of my favorite ones, but I'm sorry the plot and the action is just bad! The conversations in the movie are boring. Don't waste time. Al Pacino's worst movie ever!

This movie has Al Pacino, Christopher Walken, Alan Arkin, and as a small side note Julianna Margulies.  And no i don't include her as a legend actress. But it was great to see her in it, if only for a moment. Fist in my humble opinion, Once you see the first three actors I think you just order it as a must see. The plot is good.  Story line is great.  Acting is just fantastic.  TheY really cleaned up Walken for this role. Al Pacino's character looks a little beat up. And Arkin looks about the same. I won't give anything away. The story is basically this.  Al Pacino and his two friends were not the most law abiding men. Some events took place, Al Pacino's character took the fall for everyone and went to jail.  They are old school hence the title "Stand Up Guys".  These guys don't rat on anyone. Well During one of the events 25 years earlier at least i think, along with the illegal things they were doing, which they don't go into that much, but enough for you to get the point, something goes very wrong, and Al Pacino's character is blamed by a mob boss. Now, Walkens character is the only one who kept in touch, and sent care packages. Walkens also has issues, as in no contact with his daughter or granddaughter.  These things he is working on. Pacino while out tells walken to get a move on and get his family straight. But Walken is not thinking about that as much at the moment. Al Pacino just got out of jail and he is still a bit of a party animal and wants to have fun. So Walken is keeping an eye on his best friend, Pacino's Character. The mistake I mentioned earlier was that some big mob boss seemed fit to blame on Pacino's character, and this is really the main theme of the movie more so and the few that are left from the earlier crew, they are gone except the few you see. They add up to three?  Well these three that are left, their  involvement now that Pacino is out is also a big deal in keeping with the theme.

I cant go into anymore than that without giving anything away. What i can tell you is this.  It is first class acting for any generation, a story for any generation, and it does keep you on the edge of your seat or i should say suspenseful until the very end. There is no way you can go wrong. They also add dry humor, sarcastic humor in there at the exact moments you would want it. It was written perfectly in my eyes.  Even if you are not great fans of any of these people, and i cant see how you cant be, but even if your not, it is just a breath of fresh air in terms of movies that have been coming out over the last five years. Maybe decade.  These actors and actresses just work perfectly together and have great chemistry. I give it 5 stars and i say watch it.  You won't be disappointed in this movie. It brings out so many emotions as well up to the very end. I loved it. And i think you guys and gals will to.
